data.title: Debug hover: Do not line function body

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: I think we should only show function name and parameters in the hover and not inline the body, it is very verbose and typically not enough space to show all.

data.title: Welcome page breaks continuous integration tests in Linux
data.body:
Since #2166 the Travis CI tests in Linux have been failing. Code opens a Firefox window which seems to break our test interaction with Code itself.

ping @SofianHn

data.title: Feedback New welcome page
data.body:
Testing #2251 on OS X

Feedback:
- We need to ensure that the welcome page loads fast. The first time I've tried it took > 10s to load.
- I use Safari in Full screen mode, when the welcome page showed up in the browser it switches to Safari in full screen and I got disoriented. The welcome page should have some hint that I've installed VS Code and can now go back to it.
  - Is there a way hide the welcome page from the welcome page so that I can easily get back to VS Code?

FYI @SofianHn @bgashler1

data.title: Tab inside markdown preview moves focus around markdown preview element
data.body:
- markdown preview
- try to tab out of the file, the focus is moved throught the element in the file
- not sure if this is intended behavior because the file can be arbiterarly large and then it is hard fo focus out of the editor

data.title: REPL is not keyboard accessible
data.body: We seem to hide focus in the repl and complex hover when you click with the left mouse, but not with the right mouse. Not sure what the story is here but it is also a problem for accessibility because I cannot access elements using keyboard.

data.title: Can not tab out of the left side of a diff editor
data.body:
diff editor, click on left side
try to tab out of it - focus does not move anywhere, it is stuck

data.title: Widgets inside editor should come last in their order of visibility when tabbing
data.body: When I use Tab to tab into the editor and have widgets open (e.g. find widget, view zone), focus jumps first between these widgets and then into the editor. I would think that focus should first move into the editor and then to the widgets in their order.

data.title: Panel doesn't allign well when side bar is pinned to the right

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
See screen shot. The header of the editor aligns well with the header of the side bar however the header of the panel somehow 'stops' at the side bar without a nice visual ending.
![capture](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1931590/12578529/b502a27e-c421-11e5-8874-b47aa23b976c.png)

data.title: Debug: Conditional breakpoints are not keyboard accessible
data.body: There is no entry for conditional breakpoints in the command pallette. Also for editing a condition.

data.title: Missing variables and call stack when pausing application
Improve "localRoot" and "remoteRoot" documentation/usage
data.body:
I think `localRoot` should default to the workspace root. That way, the user only needs to specific `remoteRoot` if he already has the `localRoot` opened in VSCode, which I think will be the most common use case.

We can also mention in `localRoot`'s documentation that it does indeed default to the workspace root, if unspecified.

data.title: [css] CSS hovers not showing
Breakpoint not hit
JSON squiggle not showing
monaco-shell does not show focus
data.body:
First time you tab out of the editor, the focus is passed to monaco-shell but it does not show focus in any noticable way to me

Maybe we create an accessibility tag on github?

data.title: Anyone know why the description of completion item in c# didn't show full Signature ?
data.body:
As we know ,when we type "." after a class of c# in visual studio, it will trigger completion item ui pop up, and the method description in each of  completion item will contains full signature as following:
![22](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/15098626/12577517/b0666686-c455-11e5-9162-647abe32afc0.png)

but when type c# as the scenario in the up in vscode , the description don't have full signature, 

![11](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/15098626/12577491/872063ee-c455-11e5-8702-5eb91c620c77.png)

(note :Typescript  in vscode can also has full signature as following:)
![44](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/15098626/12577603/4804a07a-c456-11e5-9bef-0d1d51c1ca62.png)

Anyone can tell me how to get the full Signature of c# method in completionitem ?

data.title: backspace no longer triggers intellisense

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- open a TypeScript file
- type `document` and see `document` and `DocumentType` (and others)
- type another `t` 
- hit backspace :arrow_right: no more suggestions

data.title: SignatureHelp UI is still open when completionlist ui open
data.body:
Repro steps:
1. type c# code as following to trigger the SignatureHelp UI:
   Console.Beep(
2. backspace four characters ,signaturehelp ui still exists when completionlist ui display  

![33](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/15098626/12577242/1de2b748-c454-11e5-87fa-75d9a43e69fe.png)

data.title: Automatically indent "end" for ruby code
data.body:
In VSCode 0.10.6 the "end" in ruby doesn't gets indented after writing it. It should be handled like the brackets in Javascript.

Left: VSCode, Right: Atom (Gif. Reload to see it again)
![indentation](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5446019/12576889/3594f97e-c417-11e5-9006-71117fa4de04.gif)
